TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ClaimsAuthorizationModule extends System.IdentityModel.Services.HttpModuleBase

Docs.summary: Represents an HTTP module that performs claims-based authorization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class enables claims-based authorization by serving as an HTTP module in the HTTP processing pipeline.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Authorize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the requestor (principal) is authorized for the current request.
Docs.returns: if the principal is authorized; otherwise, . The default is if no claims authentication manager is associated with this module.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The claims authentication manager specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsAuthorizationModule.ClaimsAuthorizationManager%2A> property is invoked to authorize the request.

Docs.exception: The associated with the request is not authorized.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current claims authorization manager instance that is used by this module.
Docs.value: The claims authorization manager instance or if no claims authorization manager is associated with this module.
Docs.exception: An attempt to set the property to occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the module.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void InitializeModule(class System.Web.HttpApplication context) cil managed

Docs.param: The application object that contains this module.
Docs.summary: Initializes the module and prepares it to handle events from its [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] application object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void InitializePropertiesFromConfiguration() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the module properties based on definitions in the configuration file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsAuthorizationModule.ClaimsAuthorizationManager%2A> property from the claims authorization manager that is specified in configuration by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.ClaimsAuthorizationManager%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration> object set on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object that is set on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. You can specify the claims authentication manager in a configuration file through the [\<claimsAuthorizationManager\>](../Topic/%3CclaimsAuthorizationManager%3E.md) element.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnAuthorizeRequest (object sender, EventArgs args);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnAuthorizeRequest(object sender, class System.EventArgs args) cil managed
